 It is curious to me that sex front to back is called "doggy style". Actually, dogs (in particular, I have read, wild dogs) tend to have sex back-to-back. Indeed, male dogs have a penis that has a bone in it which makes it difficult for a male dog to have sex unless his penis is pointing backwards. Occasionally dog breeders will ignorantly try to turn the male dog around during copulation, to copulate going forward, breaking his penis bone, which apparently is quite disastrous for the dog. 
 
 It is not hard to see that backwards-copulating male dogs finding it difficult to see what they are doing when having sex is an anti-sodomy defense that dogs have, in that the male dog has a harder time controlling things relative to the female dog. But I don't think this defense is quite so advantageous as the female human's tendency to have sex from the front.
 
 Insofar as the word "unnatural" is concerned, I would say that there is a good deal of equivocation going on. Were I to say that sodomy is "unnatural", I would mean that the tendency to want to be sodomized is "adventitious", i.e., "added from another source and not inherent or innate", in the sense that it is likely caused by some external man-made deception or quite possibly as a result of having been focibly addicted to it. The tendency to want to be sodomized is unnatural is the sense that it is adventitious, not in the sense that it is not a tendency that occurs in nature. I would be the first to tell you that sodomy has been the curse of non-monotreme mammals since (with a few exceptions) they evolved to have an opening for the reproductive system separate from the digestive system (I'm guessing scientists think this occurred about 100 million years ago), thereby presumably making sex itself not significantly chemically addictive. Actually, "not occuring in nature" is not one of the definitions my dictionary gives for natural, and most of the definitions more resemble the definition of adventitious (admittedly an obscure word). E.g., one definition is "not being in accordance or consistent with a normal course of events: PERVERSE" (Webster's Ninth Collegiate). This definition in a way makes the word "unnatural" preferable to "adventitious" when applied to sodomy (as opposed to the tendency to want to be sodomized). After all, there is no reason to believe that the tendency to sodomize (in contradictinction to the tendency to want to be sodomized) is particularly adventitious--it's just an evil character flaw that some people are to a certain extent born with just like some people are to a certain extent born with other character flaws.  Sodomy I define to be a behavior that introduces semen into the digestive sytem; i.e., oral sodomy or rectal sodomy. I tend to exclude copulation involving non-human animals, not because I think bestiality is innocuous, but because it is sufficiently unrelated to sodomy as I define it as for it to deserve a separate word (which word "bestiality" suffices nicely). E.g., when I talk about the sodomite community, I don't want to imply that the people I am arguing against believe in bestiality (which I should think very few people believe in), and I don't want to have to say something long like the "oral sodomy and rectal sodomy community." My definition seems the most useful, and apparently it agrees with the legal definition that you saw at LegalDefinitions.com, so fine. I don't like the terms "oral sex" and "anal sex" though; indeed, there is great harm in people thinking sodomy is basically sex; the terms "oral sodomy" and "rectal sodomy" are preferable, IMO. No reason to degrade sex. Not that there is any harm in defining a word a little bit non-standardly so long as you are clear about what your definition is. Such an approach is often preferable to inventing a new word or to adopting an awkwardly long phrase.

 Open Letter To 'Dr.' Laura
 Laura Schlessinger is a US radio personality who dispenses sex advice to people who call in to her radio show. Recently, she said that, as an observant Orthodox Jew, homosexuality is an abomination according to Leviticus 18:22 and cannot be condoned in any circumstance. The following is an open letter to 'Dr.' Laura penned by a US resident, which was posted on the Internet:
 
 Dear Dr. Laura:
 Thank you for doing so much to educate people regarding God's Law. I have learned a great deal from your radio show, and I try to share that knowledge with as many people as I can. When someone tries to defend the homosexual lifestyle, for example, I simply remind them that Leviticus 18:22 clearly states it to be an abomination. End of debate.
 
 I do need some advice from you, however, regarding some of the specific Bible laws and how to follow them. 
 a) When I burn a bull on the altar as a sacrifice, I know it creates a pleasing odor for the Lord (Lev. 1:9). The problem is my neighbors. They claim the odor is not pleasing to them. Should I smite them? 
 b) I would like to sell my daughter into slavery, as sanctioned in Exodus 21:7. In this day and age, what do you think would be a fair price for her? She's 18 and starting University. Will the slave buyer continue to pay for her education by law? 
 c) I know that I am allowed no contact with a woman while she is in her period of menstrual uncleanliness (Lev. 15:19-24). The problem is, how do I tell? I have tried asking, but most women take offense. I'm sure you have found a way to do this and can share it with me.
 d) Lev. 25:44 states that I may indeed possess slaves, both male and female, provided they are purchased from neighboring nations. A friend of mine claims that this applies to Mexicans, but not Canadians. Can you clarify? Why can't I own Canadians?
 e) I have a neighbor who insists on working on the Sabbath. Exodus 35:2 clearly states he should be put to death. Am I morally obligated to kill him myself, or should this be a neighborhood improvement project?
 f) A friend of mine feels that even though eating shellfish is an abomination (Lev. 11:10), it is a lesser abomination than homosexuality. I don't agree. Can you settle this?
 g) Lev. 21:20 states that I may not approach the altar of God if I have a defect in my sight. I have to admit that I wear reading glasses. Does my vision have to be 20/20, or is there some wiggle room here? Would contact lenses help?
 h) Most of my male friends get their hair trimmed, including the hair around their temples, even though this is expressly forbidden by Lev.19:27. How should they die?
 i) I know from Lev. 11:6-8 that touching the skin of a dead pig makes me unclean, but may I still play football if I wear hemp gloves?
 j) My uncle has a farm. He violates Lev. 19:19 by planting two different crops in the same field, as does his wife by wearing garments made of two different kinds of thread (cotton/polyester blend). He also tends to curse and blaspheme a lot. Is it really necessary that we go to all the trouble of getting the whole town together to stone them? (Lev.24:10-16) Couldn't we just burn them to death at a private family affair like we do with people who sleep with their in-laws? (Lev. 20:14)
 I know you have studied these things extensively, so I am confident you can help. Thank you again for reminding us that God's word is eternal and unchanging.
 Your devoted disciple and adoring fan,
 J. Kent Ashcroft (author of the original version)

Sir, you missed the entire point. The very definition of sodomy includes all versions of sex that is "unnatural" or "abnormal". Different positions, oral sex and anal sex is considered sodomy. My point was that if you condemn sodomy, you condem the heterosexual community also. And it makes for a very boring sex life. The definition of sodomy is entirely to vague to be a synonym for homosexual. Homosexuals don't have sex with animals. Heterosexuals do have oral sex and various positions. Both of these are considered sodomy by definition.
 The only "evil" involved in sex is when one partner is unwilling. Other than that, who is dominant or who is submissive (top or bottom), or who is doing the penetrating or being penetrated is a moot point.

 
 IMHO...I think, personally, that it is faulty to try and define heterosexuality or homsexuality via sexual acts. Sodomy does not = homosexuality. Regardless of how we look at it, it is a faulty formula.

 As a Christian, I think that many times, our address of homosexuality via Scripture has taken on the form equiavalent of gay bashing or bigotry against homosexuals. Why?
 
 We (generalizing about contermporary US Christianity - more or less talking about Evangelical America and mainline Protestantism) have used the Bible to somehow single out or draw special attention to homosexuality and imply that it is somehow a special, particularly terrible aspect of human sinfulness that deserves specific judgement and intolerance.
 
 There is nothing that I have found, in scripture, to warrant any special pointing out of, hatred of, or singling out of homosexuality apart from any other aspect of our human sinfulness. If I am accepting of liars, cheats, backbiters, slanderers amidst my community and my church family, why should I somehow kick out the gays? 
 
 I don't think we should.
 
 MC
